cron.description: The cron expression to run the backup, You can create and test the expression on https://crontab.guru/

source.description: Configuration for all git hoster source endpoints

destination.description: Configuration for all git hoster destination endpoints

structured.description: if set to `true`, it checks out the repos in a more structured way, like `hoster/user|organization/repository`

bare.description: clone the repository as a bare repository

endpoint.description: The endpoint of the S3 server

structured.description: if set to `true`, it checks out the repos in a more structured way, like `hoster/user|organization/repository`

bucket.description: The bucket to store the backups in

accesskey.description: The access key to authenticate against the S3 server

secretkey.description: The secret key to authenticate against the S3 server

usessl.description: Use SSL to connect to the S3 server

token.description: The token to authenticate against the source

token_file.description: Alternatively, specify the token in a file, relative to current working directory when executed

url.description: The url to the source repository

user.description: The user you want to clone the repositories from. If you want to get everything from your user, leave out the user parameter and just use the token.

organization.description: The organization to clone the repositories from

username.description: The username to authenticate against the source

password.description: The password to authenticate against the source

ssh.description: Use ssh instead of https to clone the repositories

sshkey.description: The path to the ssh key to use for cloning the repositories

exclude.description: A list of repositories to exclude from the backup

include.description: A list of repositories to include in the backup

excludeorgs.description: A list of organizations to exclude from the backup

includeorgs.description: A list of organizations to include in the backup

wiki.description: Include the wiki in the backup

starred.description: Include the starred repositories in the backup

issues.description: Include the issues in the backup, only available for `local` destination

gists.description: Include the gists in the backup

token.description: The token to authenticate against the destination

token_file.description: Alternatively, specify the token in a file, relative to current working directory when executed

url.description: The url to the destination repository

user.description: The user/org you want to backup the repositories to

organization.description: The organization to backup the repositories to

sshkey.description: The path to the ssh key to use for pushing the repositories

createorg.description: Create the organization if it does not exist

lfs.description: Use lfs to push the repositories

lastactivity.description: Only clone repositories that have been active in the last x days. The value is a string that can be parsed by the time.ParseDuration function from the go standard library.

stars.description: Only clone repositories that have more than x stars

languages.description: Only clone repositories that are written in one of the specified languages

repositories.description: The visibility of the repositories to clone

organizations.description: The visibility of the organizations to clone

mirrorinterval.description: The interval to mirror the repositories. The value is a string that can be parsed by the time.ParseDuration function from the go standard library.

timeformat.description: The time format to use in the logs, The basics for time formats can be found at https://yourbasic.org/golang/format-parse-string-time-date-example.

dir.description: The directory to store the logs in

file.description: The file to store the logs in

maxage.description: The maximum age of the log file in days

endpoint.description: The endpoint to expose the metrics on

heartbeat.description: Configure heartbeat for services like https://healthchecks.io/ or https://deadmanssnitch.com/ (optional)

urls.description: A list of urls to check for heartbeat

push.description: Configure pushgateways to get notifications on your phone or browser (optional)

url.description: The url to your nty server

token.description: The token to authenticate against the nty server

user.description: The user to authenticate against the nty server

password.description: The password to authenticate against the nty server

url.description: The url to your gotify server

token.description: The token to authenticate against the gotify server
